intro: Draba cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's whitlowgrass, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring and is often found in rocky or sandy soils in alpine and arid environments. Draba cusickii has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is considered a rare and endemic species in its range.
